Help.Description:
Allows the process to wait the given amount of milliseconds before executing the given command.
The delay command works differently depending on the number of arguments. With three arguments #delay has the same syntax as the #tick command, allowing you to name the delay.
If you use a named delay and a delay with the exact same name is currently pending, it will be removed and never execute. Using a named delay also makes it easier to use the #undelay command.
Example: #delay {oven timer} {#showme Check the oven!} {600} Same as above, instead using a named delay.
Help.Example: Informs you after 1 minute to check the oven.
